text: District 6 is an electoral district in Malta. It was established in 1921. Its boundaries have changed many times but it currently consists of the localities of Ħal Luqa, Ħal Qormi and Is-Siġġiewi. ==Representatives== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Election !colspan=10|Representatives |- !1921 |rowspan=2; style="background-color: " | |rowspan=2|Francesco Buhagiar (UPM) |rowspan=4; style="background-color: " | |rowspan=1|Gerald Strickland (Conservative) |rowspan=1; style="background-color: " | |rowspan=1|Luigi Borg (UPM) |rowspan=4; style="background-color: " | |rowspan=4|Walter Salamone (Conservative) | style="background-color:#FFFFFF" rowspan=4 colspan=2| 4 seats 1921–1935 |- !1924 |rowspan=3|John Bugeja (Conservative) |rowspan=1; style="background-color: " | |rowspan=1|Salvatore Zammit Hammet (Labour) |- !1927 |rowspan=1; style="background-color: " | |rowspan=1|Roger Strickland (Conservative) |rowspan=2; style="background-color: " | |rowspan=2|Tommaso Fenech (Nationalist) |- !1932 |rowspan=1; style="background-color: " | |rowspan=1|Rosario Mizzi (Nationalist) |- !colspan=13|District suspended |- !1947 |rowspan=18; style="background-color: " | |rowspan=1|Gerard Cassar (Labour) |rowspan=5; style="background-color: " | |rowspan=2|Joseph Schembri (Labour) |rowspan=2; style="background-color: " | |rowspan=1|Robert Bencini (Labour) |rowspan=1; style="background-color: " | |rowspan=1|Albert V.
